item.title: Sitting in the shade
item.summary: The shade not to be sat in, unless it is really summer. In the Katkop dialect, by Díä!kwãin (L V.-15. 5149 rev. and 5150 rev.). Dia!kwain's mother told him what happens if one sits in the shade when the weather is not very hot.
item.comments: 1) Dia!kwain heard this story from his mother (≠kamme-an), 2) This story is found in Book V-15
item.author: Dia!kwain (David Hoesar) (V)
